content: hijab finishing sewing on her hijab make sure the cast on end is weaved in slide the hijab for shoulders over the top of the head and into position see figure e i position the top just under the head hole use the cast off end to sew it into place hide end inside be careful not to stitch the 2 sides together skirt decoration if desired add duplicate stitch to make hearts on the bottom of the dress choose a nice contrasting color so it is more visible against the dress weaving in ends put your finger puppet inside out weave in the ends i try not to weave in any ends where the head hole will show through as i think it looks messy i also try to weave my ends in to the same color so they are less visible boy finishing because the boy s hair is short it does not require any finishing pants seams for the pant seams embroider one long stitch in the middle of his pants see figure f once happy with the placement turn your doll inside out and knot the 2 ends together at the top see figure g instead of weaving them in trim your ends with scissors as then they won t show through the fabric weaving in ends put your finger puppet inside out weave in the ends i try not to weave in any ends where the head hole will show through as i think it looks messy i also try to weave my ends in to the same color then the ends aren t as visible through the fabric figure e figure f figure g thanks & pattern support thanks for making a fingerprint puppet for pattern support just pm me on ravelry if you would like to send your puppets to knitting4peace you can find their address on page 2 and their donation guidelines on page 7 want another fun knit for charity check out the information on peace pals on page 7 6 donation guidelines thank you so much for sharing your talents with knitting4peace and their community partners before you send your puppets to knitting4peace please remember the following guidelines which allow them to quickly and efficiently distribute requested items to those in need 1 make sure your puppet is large enough to fit on an adult s finger and stay there for play 2 do not attach any chokeables like beads to your puppets since the finger puppets are used primarily with young infants this is important 3 avoid pet hair smoke or perfumes when creating they do not have facilities to wash items 4 do not add tags to items as they need to be removed before they distribute them 5 make sure all your yarn ends are sewn in 6 is your finger puppet 100% complete partially finished items cannot be used 7 ask yourself-is this an item i would be proud to
